business.headline: Sensex, Nifty open marginally higher on positive global cues; Paytm up 9%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 47.27 points to 81,512.27, while the NSE Nifty50 shed 18.70 points to 24,917.70.

Crypto firm WazirX's security partner says no evidence of cyberattack on its systemThe cyberattack on crypto exchange WazirX in July, that led to a loss of about Rs 2,000 crore in digital assets, had originated from their end, according to its security partner and digital asset custody company, Liminal Custody.

GST rates on cancer drugs cut, decision on health insurance postponedFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, who chaired the GST Council meeting, said that GST rates on some cancer drugs have been reduced to 5 per cent from 12 per cent.

GST Council delays decision on insurance premiums to next meeting: ReportCurrently, policyholders are paying 18% GST on their premiums, and many hoped this rate would be reduced to ease the financial pressure.

Bajaj Housing Finance IPO fully subscribed. Check latest GMP, subscriptionBajaj Housing Finance IPO fully subscribed: The proceeds from this public offering will be used to strengthen Bajaj Housing Finance's capital base, positioning it to meet future business needs.
Sensex, Nifty end higher as financial stocks surge, Godfrey Phillips down 5%The S&P BSE Sensex added 375.61 points to close at 81,559.54, while the Nifty50 gained 84.25 points to end at 24,936.40.
Government to monitor airline prices amid holiday travel surgeThe festive season typically sees a spike in travel demand, which often leads to increased ticket prices.

Caught in a whirlwind: Sebi's Madhabi Puri Buch faces mounting scrutinyUnder increasing pressure from external allegations and internal unrest, Sebi Chairperson Madhabi Puri Buch faces a turbulent period marked by accusations of conflict of interest and claims of a toxic work culture. The path ahead remains uncertain.

18% GST on transactions under Rs 2,000 awaits fitment committee's call: ReportThe GST council did not make a final decision and chose to refer the issue to the fitment committee for further analysis and recommendations.

Bajaj Housing Finance IPO: Should you subscribe or skip?Bajaj Housing Finance IPO: The company aims to raise up to Rs 7,000 crore through the IPO, which includes both fresh equity and an offer-for-sale component.
Volkswagen proposes first-ever factory closure in Germany. Why it's a big deal?Volkswagen's management has revealed that the company's core brand needs to save 10 billion euros by 2026.
IndiGo plans to double international routes to 40 by year-end: ReportThe plan is part of a broader strategy to establish IndiGo as a leading global airline by 2030.

GST Council Meeting: Major relief likely for insurance buyers? The Goods and Services Tax (GST) Council, which is meeting on September 9, 2024, in New Delhi, is expected to discuss the possibility of removing the 18% GST on term life insurance premiums.
Adani Group warns Bangladesh over $500 million in unpaid power duesDespite recent growth, Bangladesh continues to face chronic energy shortages, worsened by dwindling domestic gas reserves.

Gala Precision Engineering makes solid market debut. Hold or sell? Gala Precision Engineering IPO listing: The shares of the company made a strong debut, listing at a 42% premium over the issue price on the Bombay Stock Exchange.

Bajaj Housing Finance IPO: 10 points you need to knowThe proceeds from this public offering will be used to strengthen Bajaj Housing Finance's capital base, positioning it to meet future business needs.

GST Council Meet today: Insurance tax, payment aggregators — what to expectGST Council Meeting: The session is expected to address several critical topics, including the taxation of insurance premiums, proposed rate rationalisations, and more.

Should you apply for Bajaj Housing Finance IPO? Check GMP, expected gainsBajaj Housing Finance IPO: Investors are anticipating strong listing gains, as indicated by the company's grey market premium (GMP).

Sensex, Nifty open lower as weak US jobs data reignites recession fearsThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 181.90 points at 81,002 at 9:19 am, while the NSE NIfty50 declined 49.55 points to trade at 24,802.60.

Maximising returns: How to select top mutual funds for your portfolioMutual funds have emerged as a popular investment option, offering a balanced approach to growing wealth without the complexity of managing individual stocks.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Rahul Gandhi's swipe at PM, RSS again at US event: 56 inch is history nowAddressing the Indian diaspora community in Herndon, Virginia, on Monday, the Congress leader said that "something has definitely changed" in India following the general elections, adding that the atmosphere of fear vanished.

Train derailment bid foiled in Ajmer, cement blocks found on tracksA major train tragedy was averted also on Sunday when the Kalindi Express, travelling from Prayagraj to Bhiwani in Haryana, hit an LPG cylinder placed on the rail track in Kanpur.

Apple iPhone 16 and iPhone 16 Pro quick review: All the changes you cannot seeApple has launched new iPhones: the iPhone 16, iPhone 16 Plus, iPhone 16 Pro and the iPhone 16 Pro Max. They might look familiar but there are some significant changes under the hood.

How realistic is Joe Root's threat to Sachin Tendulkar's record?England batter Joe Root is slowly closing in on Sachin Tendulkar in the list of leading run scorers in Test cricket. Here's a look at their numbers at different stages of their career.

Aditi Rao, Siddharth are all smiles in new pic with Apple head Tim CookActors Aditi Rao Hydari and Siddharth attended the launch of iPhone 16 series in the USA. They shared new pictures with Apple CEO, Tim Cook, on Instagram.

Rahul Gandhi says PM Modi had 'psychological collapse' during election campaignCongress leader and Leader of Opposition in Lok Sabha Rahul Gandhi said that Prime Minister Narendra Modi had a psychological collapse when he understood that they were not winning 300–400 seats in the Lok Sabha elections.

Apple iPhone 16 series launched. See India prices, full specifications and moreApple has finally launched the new iPhone 16 series in India and other global markets. The standard iPhone 16 models have received several upgrades, which is likely to make people buy the new version. Here are India price details and full specs.

Trinamool debunks RG Kar's treatment claim on 28-year-old man's deathThe Trinamool Congress disputed claims by Kolkata's RG Kar Hospital that a 28-year-old man who died there received timely treatment, instead citing the mother's testimony that alleges medical negligence and lack of doctors.

Dramatic bridge collapse in typhoon-hit Vietnam, lorry, cars fall into riverAt least eight people are missing after a 30-year-old bridge over the Red River in the northern province of Phu Tho collapsed as Typhoon Yagi hit northern Vietnam.

Maharashtra BJP chief's son flees after his Audi hits several vehicles in NagpurAn Audi registered in Maharashtra BJP chief's son hit several vehicles in Nagpur, with three occupants of the car, including Sanket Bawankule, fleeing from the scene.

Saina Nehwal hits back at trolls for belittling her 2012 Olympics bronze medalIndia badminton star Saina Nehwal has hit back at her trolls for questioning her bronze medal win during the 2012 London Olympics. Nehwal became the first Indian shuttle to win a bronze medal.
iPhone 16 launched but there are other products too: Everything Apple announced at Glowtime eventiPhone 16 launched but there are other products too: Everything Apple announced at Glowtime event
Late sleepers face higher diabetes risk, study reveals beyond lifestyle factorsPeople who prefer staying up late, face a 50% higher risk of developing type 2 diabetes compared to early risers.

Tamil Nadu Minister's driver, friends sexually assaulted girl, claims BJP leaderSelva Kumar, vice president of the BJP's industrial wing in Tamil Nadu, said the accused driver worked for School Education Minister Anbil Mahesh. He said the accused sexually assaulted the girl multiple times by blackmailing her with a video of the crime.
Apple Watch Series 10 quick review: Look, it's now biggerApple Watch Series 10 keeps the design of the Watch similar to the old one, but it is now slightly slimmer and noticeably bigger.

Rahul Gandhi's fresh dig at RSS in US: They say certain states inferior to othersCongress leader and Leader of Opposition in Lok Sabha, Rahul Gandhi, said the RSS doesn't understand India as the party says certain states are inferior to others.

Can you drink vinegar for glowing skin? Viral video says do as the Japanese doTired of trying every skincare product under the sun and your skin still doesn't care? It's time to give Japanese drinking vinegar a try.
Teen travels 265 km to meet online friend, locked in hotel for 20 daysThe girl was rescued  by the "SHE Teams", a wing of Hyderabad Police on Saturday and the 19-year-old accused was arrested.
Domestic help found dead at Samajwadi Party MLA's home, cops say suicideThe 17-year-old victim's family said she had been working at the MLA Zahid Beg's residence for the past six years.

Pavithra Gowda asked Darshan not to let Renukaswamy go, kill him: PoliceAccording to the chargesheet filed by Bengaluru Police, Pavithra Gowda instigated actor Darshan and other accused to kill Renukaswamy for sending her obscene messages on social media.

Video: Andhra cops line up liquor bottles for disposal, locals grab and run offLiquor enthusiasts in Andhra Pradesh's Guntur rushed to grab bottles of alcohol while police were destroying seized illicit liquor at a dumping yard on Etukuru Road.
IIT student found dead in hostel room in Guwahati, protest eruptsThe body of the male student, who hailed from Uttar Pradesh, was found in his room in the Brahmaputra Hostel.

Protesters carry out torch rally near Governor's residence in Manipur This came days after a fresh wave of violence gripped Manipur, with multiple attacks and killings reported across several districts in the state.
James Earl Jones, iconic voice of Darth Vader and Mufasa, dies at 93Jones, a longtime sufferer of diabetes, died at his home surrounded by family members, his agent, Barry McPherson, said.

Aditi Rao, Siddharth are all smiles in new pic with Apple head Tim CookActors Aditi Rao Hydari and Siddharth attended the launch of iPhone 16 series in the USA. They shared new pictures with Apple CEO, Tim Cook, on Instagram.

KBC 16: Big B reacts to contestant's question about spending time with wife JayaIn the latest episode of Kaun Banega Crorepati 16, a contestant asked Amitabh Bachchan about spending time with his wife, Jaya Bachchan. The veteran actor's reply left everyone impressed.

Lollapalooza India 2025: Shawn Mendes to headline 3rd edition in Mumbai  Canadian singer-songwriter Shawn Mendes will headline the third edition of Lollapalooza India. The music festival will happen over two days in March 2025.

Joe Root gives bizarre Coldplay analogy after third test loss against Sri Lanka Star England batter Joe Root compared the England cricket team with the British band Coldplay following their loss against Sri Lanka in the third Test at Kennington Oval.

Yash Dayal's father praises son's fighting spirit after maiden India call upYash Dayal's father Chandrapal reflected on his son's struggles after his maiden call up to the Indian team for the Bangladesh series.

England bowl Ireland out for 45, register a record 275-run winEngland women romped to a record 275-run victory over Ireland in the second ODI in Belfast, bowling their hosts out for just 45 to clinch a series win with one game to play.

Sanju Samson becomes co-owner of Kerala Super League club Malappuram FCIndia cricketer Sanju Samson has become the co-owner of the Kerala Super League club, Malappuram FC. The club made the announcement on Monday, September 9.

3-0 is not what happened: India boss Manolo Marquez happy despite Syria lossIndia boss Manolo Marquez said that he was happy with his side's performance despite their 3-0 loss to Syria in the Intercontinental Cup 2024 on Monday, September 9.

Kane inspired by Ronaldo's longevity: Want to play for as long as possibleHarry Kane has stated that he believes he is at his "physical and mental peak" and underlined his intention to emulate Cristiano Ronaldo by playing into his late thirties.

Intercontinental Cup 2024: Syria down hapless India 3-0 to win titleSyria downed a hapless India 3-0 to secure the Intercontinental Cup 2024 on Monday, September 2024 in Hyderabad. The Indian defence had a rough day at the office as Manolo Marquez' first assignment as coach ended on a sour note.

Bajrang takes NADA to court to compete in World Wrestling ChampionshipsOlympic bronze medallist Bajrang Punia has moved the Delhi High Court against NADA, seeking permission to compete in the World Wrestling Championships after being suspended. Bajrang alleged multiple violations by NADA during the doping test process.

Jannik Sinner tightens grip on No. 1 spot, Taylor Fritz returns to top 10US Open men's singles champion Jannik Sinner tightened his grip on the No. 1 spot while runner-up Taylor Fritz returned to the top 10 in the ATP rankings at No. 7 on Monday.

Mocked by neighbours, Deepthi fights social stigma to win Paralympic medalParalympics 2024: Speaking to India Today, track and field medalist Deepthi Jeevanji recalled her tough road to glory. Deepthi, 20, faced hostility from a bunch of superstitious neighbours, who ridiculed her intellectual impairment and suggested she be sent to an orphanage

KL Rahul likely to start ahead of Sarfaraz Khan in Test series vs BangladeshKL Rahul's experience in Test cricket is expected to give him the edge over the fearless Sarfaraz Khan for India's Test series against Bangladesh. The team management is also focusing on the upcoming tour of Australia, where Rahul's past performances may prove crucial.

Credit to Sri Lanka but Oval Test loss not down to 'complacency': Ollie PopeEngland's stand-in captain Ollie Pope has claimed that complacency wasn't a reason behind his side's loss to Sri Lanka at the Oval on Monday, September 9. Sri Lanka prevented a clean sweep by the hosts on Monday.

'Neighbours used to call me monkey': Deepthi Jeevanji recalls road to Paralympics gloryParis Paralympics: Deepthi Jeevanji, speaking to India Today, recalled her battle against the odds and support from family in her journey to Paralympic glory. The 20-year-old from Warangal, Telangana, won a bronze medal in the women's 400m T20 event.

Olly Stone to replace rested Gus Atkinson in England squad for Australia ODIsThe England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB) announced that fast bowler Gus Atkinson will be rested for this month's One-Day International series against Australia, with Olly Stone selected as his replacement.

Sri Lanka's De Silva emotional after rare England win: Happiest moment Sri Lanka captain Dhananjaya de Silva was emotional after leading his team to a remarkable Test victory over England at The Oval. The eight-wicket win marked Sri Lanka's first Test triumph on English soil in a decade.

Shiv Aroor's Take: Decimating stereotypes, Indian heroes script Paralympic historyParis Paralympics: In his popular segment, senior editor Shiv Aroor sheds light on the inspiring stories of India's Paralympic heroes from Paris. India shattered records and rallied against the odds to win 29 medals, its highest-ever tally in the history of the Paralympics.

Paris 2024: How Neeraj Chopra inspired Paralympics champion Navdeep SinghIn an exclusive interaction with India Today, Paralympic champion Navdeep Singh revealed how Neeraj Chopra inspired him to take up javelin throw. Navdeep secured the gold medal in Paris with a record throw of 47.32 m.

Olly Stone to replace rested Gus Atkinson in England squad for Australia ODIsThe England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB) announced that fast bowler Gus Atkinson will be rested for this month's One-Day International series against Australia, with Olly Stone selected as his replacement.

India shattered records and rallied against the odds to win 29 medals, its highest-ever tally in the history of the Paralympics.

Paris 2024: How Neeraj Chopra inspired Paralympics champion Navdeep SinghIn an exclusive interaction with India Today, Paralympic champion Navdeep Singh revealed how Neeraj Chopra inspired him to take up javelin throw. Navdeep secured the gold medal in Paris with a record throw of 47.32 m.

Nissanka becomes 1st Sri Lankan opener in 13 years to hit Test ton in England England vs Sri Lanka, 3rd Test: 26-year-old Pathum Nissanka became the first Sri Lankan opener since Tilakaratne Dilshan in 2011 to hit a Test hundred in England. His unbeaten 127 helped Sri Lanka end their 10-year wait for a Test victory in England.

Sri Lanka's 4th Test win in England, rare hundred for Pathum NissankaSri Lanka completed the highest successful run chase by Asian teams in England to secure their fourth Test win on English soil. Pathum Nissanka's unbeaten 127 anchored the win, marking Sri Lanka's first Test victory over England since 2014.

Paralympic champion Navdeep recalls viral celebration: 'Doesn't feel good now'Paralympic champion Navdeep Singh, in an exclusive interaction with India Today, reflected on his emotional outburst during the men's javelin F41 final at the 2024 Paralympic Games, where he ultimately secured the gold medal. In the heat of the moment, Navdeep Singh was captured on camera displaying raw frustration and using strong language after a throw. "Looking back, it doesn't feel good now," Navdeep Singh admitted, acknowledging that his intense reaction was fueled by the high stakes of the competition.

Oval Test: Pathum Nissanka Bazballs Sri Lanka to first win in England in 10 yearsPathum Nissanka was the star of the show as Sri Lanka denied England from completing a clean sweep of the series at the Oval on September 9, Monday.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

WC influential ten: Writers community honors digital social change makersWriters Community Freelancers Releases 'WC Influential Ten' List Recognizing Social Impact through Virtual Space and Social Media
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
